result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lamar Lorenzo Cammon

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed: Extension Letter from Doctor Jenna Goebel

Defendant Lamar Lorenzo Cammon in court.  Attorney Andrew Joel Golden appeared by video for Lamar Lorenzo Cammon.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a Doctor's Report Return.  No report filed.  Wisconsin Forensic Unit indicated they will call Mr. Cammon to set up an evaluation.  Court accepts misdemeanor case to be transferred to Branch 2.  Court scheduled another Doctor's Report Return.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10-19-2022
Signed and filed
Proposed order

Defendant Lamar Lorenzo Cammon appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Andrew Joel Golden appeared by video for Lamar Lorenzo Cammon.  Prosecuting attorney James C Griffin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case is calendared for a return on doctors report. No report has been filed. Case is adjourned in Branch 02.
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.

***
Case is recalled. Defense requests that Dr. Jenna Goebel be ordered to complete the NGI evaluation. Court grants request. Case is adjourned and remains as previously calendared.
signed, Order for NGI Examination

Defense entered a plea of guilty and not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect.  Court ordered defendant to be examined for NGI pursuant to Wisc. stats. 971.16. Case adjourned for return on doctor report, Branch 2.
Turnover to Justice Point for level 5 supervision, all previoulsy ordered conditions remain the same

Defendant Lamar Lorenzo Cammon in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Defendant Lamar Lorenzo Cammon in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant appears by Zoom. Doctor's report received and filed.  Parties reviewed report and do not contest findings.  Court found defendant competent to proceed and reinstated proceedings.  Arguments heard as to bail. Court orders bail amended to $500.00 cash.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Motion For Change of Plea to NGI Plea, filed by defense

Attorney Andrew Joel Golden in court, defendant Lamar Lorenzo Cammon not in court, in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
OFF THE RECORD. Case scheduled for return on doctor report. Defense requests an adjourned date. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Andrew Joel Golden in court, defendant Lamar Lorenzo Cammon not in court, in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit. Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lamar Lorenzo Cammon in court with Attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Defendant Lamar Lorenzo Cammon in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Wauwatosa Detective J. Kutz.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lamar Lorenzo Cammon not in court, defendant in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for a Preliminary hearing. SPD need more time to appoint counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lamar Lorenzo Cammon not in court, defendant in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared  for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with X.J.G; O'Reilly Auto Parts 6102 W. North Ave.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Lamar Lorenzo Cammon in court with attorney Jason A Findling.  Defendant Lamar Lorenzo Cammon in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Lamar Lorenzo Cammon appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
